intro: Talinum ankaranense, commonly known as the Ankaranense spinach, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Talinum ankaranense is also valued for its edible leaves, which are used in local cuisines.
